Stuck at 98.6%.  :(

MORE POWER TO THE WARP ENGINES!!!

A'ight peoples. I'm at 99.7% and there's more than twenty of us between 99.6 and 99.8%. Sometime in the next couple hours I should be 100%, based on what I've seen over the last couple.

 I'm heading off to slumberland right now, but before doing so I'm going to set my upload to unlimited and I'll leave it there all weekend. Hopefully that will help get the seeding on this thing rolling.
Audio is out of sync for the first episode. The other episodes seem fine though.
This doesn't appear to be full 1080p quality. It looks like 720p brought up to 1080p size. Perhaps someone with more expertise can verify.
It IS 1080p, Willravel.  It is presented in it's original 4:3 aspect ratio.

I gotta say, these look pretty damn good.

Yes, I'm sure they look better on the factory pressed blu-ray, but that ain't what we're watching here.

I've watched an episode all the way through on my PC using the VLC player, burned raw files to a DVD and watched them on a standard and 50" HDTV, and burned the first seven episodes to a DVD with a menu using ConvertXtoDVD 4. 

In ALL cases they look FAR better than they did on TV originally, on the original VHS releases and on the original DVD releases. In fact, I'm quite blown away by the quality and clarity. As many other people have mentioned in other places, it's like watching an entirely new show. I'm seeing details, colors and depth that I never new was there, and I've watched this show obsessively since it begin airing. Sometimes what you are seeing is so clear and detailed that it actually makes it look more fake. Nothing to be done about that, though. I'm sure this is how it looked on set while they were filming.

I'd like to say that the improved special effects are outstanding and impressive, etc., but I'm so amazed and engrossed by looking at everything on the screen that I'm barely noticing them. I can't recommend highly enough downloading this, or better yet, buying it, which I'll be doing very shortly.

This will definitely tide me over until I can buy the retail set.  I have already created an AVCHD and a Blu-ray to get the full quality of these files, and am very impressed.

While this was slow as hell at first, a good swarm has now built and it should come in fast for those just joining.

Thanks, afkuser2!
Yes! My download speed just jumped to 400-500 kB/s after downloading at only about 25 kB/s for around 2.5 hours. Keep seeding guys!!
